Not sure WHICH thread to post this in.. I know the moderators are trying to limit the number of new threads on this topic...

BUT this one takes the opposite view of what has already been said... WE HAVE OUR ANSWERS..... so I ask this topic NOT be merged with any others...

This is what the devs said.....

...[snip]...

OK, so clearly there was no conspiracy, no one quit, no one is angry... they left having said nothing but good things about the developers, Squad and the community... would they have said that if they had quit? No, they would either have said NOTHING.... or at the very least, allowed a hint of their anger to flow through... but it never did... because there was no anger....

Its time to end the constant speculation, the conspiracy theories and assumptions... and take what the devs said in their message at face value.... and move on.

BTW, the post the team made is very similar to the ones anyone makes when they leave the employ of a company... even moderators here have made similar posts when leaving the forum moderating team... I never once heard that they were pushed... or quit....

With 1.2 being released in a few days time... lets leave this behind and move on... all we can do is wait for Squad or the Devs to post... IF they do... if they don't ... BIG DEAL.... 1.2 is nearly here... its time to enjoy that and leave the nasty stuff behind... right?

Having been an IT manager for several years, and working in a professional career for even more, I can tell you this is standard boiler-plate language and is not necessarily something to take at face value. Even when we fired one of the worst employees we've ever had (he was truly incompetent and his coworkers knew it), we wrote a cordial announcement complimenting his work and thanking him for his time with the organization, wishing him the best in his future endeavors, etc. Just because you were a bad fit for us doesn't mean you are a horrible person and must lose face and dignity in front of all your coworkers when you're shown the door.

The same is true if you quit -- you never send a bridge-burning hate letter to your ex-employer. You want a good reference for your next job or not?

Actually, wait, we have had people leave with a bridge-burning letter and guess what -- they get the "yes, this person worked here from x date to y date. Aside from verifying dates of employment, it is our policy not to discuss the work performance of former employees - yada yada" line when employers call for work references, and we let them read between the lines and take that as a negative reference.

Public relations, management, and job stuff in general is anything but face-value.

One aspect to this is that those that left were well know to the community as well respected modders, long term devs, or both.  Due, in no small part, to the fantastic way they interacted so well with us all here on the forums.  Had they been equally talented, but less familiar staff members then I suspect the impact on the community would have been noticeably less, if it got announced at all, and the resulting 'debate' less heated even though the effect on Squad would have been the same. 

Think of it like a rock band, if the singer or lead guitarist quits its far bigger news than if the drummer or bassist leaves, even though they all had equal talent and creative input.  The band just gets a new one and carries on, and the difference in material and style gets noticed only when the next album is released, it's no better or worse than before, maybe  just a bit different to what it would have been had the lineup not changed.

While I am concerned about so many rock-et stars (ugh, the bad puns come so naturally to this thread) departing Squad at one time, I can't help but wonder about the future of the company. To work with Squad is probably very demanding and I am pretty sure that some of those that departed were hired by Squad for short term purposes, such as 1.2 debugging. While many of them are valued members of the community, to see them all walk away from Squad without any sort of official Squad explanation is sad and confusing to many of us. Do they need to give some explanation to the community? No. Should they offer some reasoning? Probably so.
